newsitem.title: ITALY: SOCCER SHOWCASE-ROMA V JUVENTUS STATISTICS.
newsitem.headline: SOCCER SHOWCASE-ROMA V JUVENTUS STATISTICS.

text.p: Facts and figures for Saturday's Italian serie A match between Roma and Juventus:
AS Roma: Formed 1927 as a merger between local clubs Alba, Fortitudo and Roman.
Major honours: Fairs Cup (now UEFA Cup) 1961, Italian league champions 1942, 1983, Italian Cup winners 1964, 1969, 1980, 1981, 1984, 1986, 1991, Anglo-Italian Cup winners 1972.
Juventus FC: Formed 1897 as Sport Club Juventus, became Juventus Football Club two years later
First league meeting in Rome: 1929/30, Juventus won 3-2.
Record victories: Juventus beat Roma 5-1 in Rome in the 1946/47 season. The biggest scoreline between the two teams in Serie A was Juventus' 7-2 home win in 1950/51.
Corresponding match last season: April 28, 1996, Roma 2 (Marco Delvecchio 4, Francesco Moriero 54) Juventus 2 (Massimiliano Cappioli 64 own goal, Michele Padovano 71), attendance 64,000.
Fascinating facts: Juventus, with Inter, are one of just two clubs never to have been relegated from serie A.
The Turin club has been owned by the Agnelli family since July 24, 1923 -- four years before Roma were founded.
Last season Juventus scored the most own goals in serie A (8) and also made the most substitutions.
Five current Juventus players have scored against Roma before but only one (Padovano) while playing for Juventus. Juventus goalkeeper Angelo Peruzzi played 16 times for Roma.
